translation.en: [narrator] The Earth, home to millions of species.
But what might live... beyond?
There are countless planets throughout the universe.
If life exists on only a fraction of them,
then the universe must be... alive.
All living things have the same needs.
To feed...
reproduce...
and evolve.
By applying the laws of life on Earth
to the rest of the universe...
it's possible to imagine
what could live...
on alien worlds.
All life forms need a planet to live on.
But how many planets are there in the universe?
translation.ko: 그렇다면 우주에는 행성이 총 몇 개 있을까요?

translation.en: [man] Think about our star,
the Sun,
with Earth, Mars, Jupiter orbiting it.
translation.ko: 지구, 화성, 목성이 그 주위를 돌죠

translation.en: For centuries,
people have asked themselves, "What about the other stars?
Uh, do they have planets as well?"
And 24 years ago,
I found one!
Didier Queloz is a superstar astrophysicist.
He has won the Nobel Prize for discovering the first planet
translation.ko: 태양계 너머에 있는 첫 행성을 발견한 공로로

translation.en: beyond our solar system.
[Didier] I was 28 years old when I found the planet.
I was about to finish my PhD,
and my PhD adviser gave me the key of the equipment.
translation.ko: 지도 교수님이 장비 사용을 허가하신 참이었죠

translation.en: And after observing a couple of times, the star 51 Peg,
translation.ko: 페가수스자리 51번 별을 몇 차례 관찰한 뒤

translation.en: I realized that something was going on on that star.
And frankly, I just panicked at that time.
I thought something was really wrong with my equipment.
And the more I wanted to understand this, the less it made sense.
translation.ko: 상황을 파악하려고 할수록 이해가 더 안 갔어요

translation.en: Until the point I got convinced it must be a planet.
That's likely to be a planet over there.
Could be Jupiter over there.
It's pretty cool.
Distant planets are invisible to telescopes
translation.ko: 멀리 있는 행성은 망원경으로 보이지 않습니다

translation.en: because they don't emit any light.
But if a planet passes in front of a star,
it casts a tiny shadow,
and there's a minuscule dimming of the star's brightness.
When astronomers detect this dip in light level,
they have found a new planet.
Hello, guys.
Uh... Oh, hey. Here is what the telescope is looking at.
This is a picture of the telescope right now.
Uh, in the middle, you have the... the target we're observing.
So, you analyze this whole field, you process the data,
translation.ko: 그 부근 전체를 분석해 데이터를 처리한 다음

translation.en: and, um, if you're lucky enough, you detect this.
There's a little bit of a decrease of the flux,
and this tells me that there is a planet orbiting that star.
translation.ko: 즉 저 별을 공전하는 행성이 존재한다는 겁니다

translation.en: [Didier] We know there are a huge number of planets in the universe.
translation.ko: 우주에는 행성이 셀 수 없이 많이 있죠

translation.en: There must be a zillion kinds of different life.
Let's imagine that this is the Earth, here...
So, imagine that one meter is 20 light-years.
So, I've made two meters as 40 light-years.
This is where you have 51 Peg, where the first planet was detected.
translation.ko: 여기 처음으로 행성이 발견된 별 페가수스자리 51번이 있어요

translation.en: Each of these tiny lights represents a star
translation.ko: 이 작은 빛 하나하나가 행성이 딸린

translation.en: where a planet has been found.
Over the next few years,
planets were turning up everywhere.
♪ Planets, planets everywhere ♪
It looks pretty cool right now. [laughs]
A horizon of stars and planets...
all around. [laughs]
Planets beyond our solar system are called exoplanets.
translation.ko: 태양계 너머의 행성은 외계 행성이라 불립니다

translation.en: Astronomers have found over 4,000 of them.
translation.ko: 천문학자들은 외계 행성을 4천 개 넘게 찾아냈죠

translation.en: And they keep finding more.
They now believe there's at least one planet for every star in the universe.
translation.ko: 이젠 우주의 모든 별에는 행성이 최소 하나 딸렸다고 봅니다

translation.en: That means over a million, billion, trillion exoplanets.
translation.ko: 즉 외계 행성은 수억, 수조 개가 존재한다는 뜻입니다

translation.en: More than all the grains of sand on Earth.
translation.ko: 지구의 모래알 수를 합친 것보다도 많습니다

translation.en: A vast canvas for the evolution of life.
The distances are mind-boggling.
The nearest exoplanets are trillions of miles from us.
translation.ko: 가장 가까운 외계 행성조차 수조 킬로미터 떨어져 있죠

translation.en: But they're all subject to the same force that holds the Earth in place.
translation.ko: 모든 행성은 지구를 묶는 힘과 같은 힘에 영향을 받습니다

translation.en: Gravity.
Imagine a world double the size of Earth,
with twice as much gravity.
This is Atlas.
How would life adapt on such a world?
translation.ko: 이런 환경에서 생물은 어떻게 적응하여 살아갈까요?

translation.en: Gravity pulls vegetation to the planet's surface.
And yet, seeds can float in the sky.
That's because gravity here is so strong.
Air molecules are densely packed together...
creating a thick, buoyant atmosphere for seeds to drift through.
translation.ko: 대기 밀도가 높아 씨앗이 뜨기 쉬운 환경입니다

translation.en: And where there are seeds...
there are sky grazers.
Giant herbivores with six wings
to ride on the dense pillow of air.
translation.ko: 여러 날개를 써서 밀도 높은 대기를 가르고 납니다

translation.en: Because of the extra gravity,
they weigh twice as much as they would on Earth.
But they don't fall from the sky.
The atmosphere is thick enough to keep them airborne.
translation.ko: 대기 밀도가 높아 충분히 날 수 있죠

translation.en: Whether on Atlas or on Earth,
flying is always a battle to overcome gravity.
[man] You might say I have a pretty complicated relationship with gravity.
translation.ko: 저와 중력과의 관계는 꽤 복잡하다고 할 수 있죠

translation.en: And you can really feel that gravity is a force pulling you down
translation.ko: 올라가려고 할수록 중력이 절 끌어 내리는 것이

translation.en: as you struggle your way up.
But ultimately, my dream has always been to be able to fly.
translation.ko: 하지만 제 꿈은 언제나 나는 것이었어요

translation.en: The thing I love most about paragliding is that it's so simple and intuitive.
It's just you and the air.
Like the sky grazers on Atlas,
paragliders use their wings to generate lift.
But the atmosphere is less dense on Earth...
translation.ko: 그러나 지구 대기는 밀도가 훨씬 낮아서

translation.en: so it takes more effort to stay airborne.
translation.ko: 떠 있기 위해서는 보다 많은 노력이 필요합니다

translation.en: [Fiorenzo] Most people don't see air as a substance.
translation.ko: 대부분 사람은 공기를 물질로 보지 않아요

translation.en: But for me, when I'm flying,
I really see it as a fluid that's moving up and down the valleys
translation.ko: 공기가 계곡과 산맥을 따라 위아래로 흐르는

translation.en: and along the ridges.
It would be really weird to fly in a very dense atmosphere.
translation.ko: 밀도 높은 대기에서 난다면 이상한 느낌일 거예요

translation.en: You could just be gliding around the whole time, effortlessly.
translation.ko: 힘 하나 안 들이고 편하게 활공할 수 있겠죠

translation.en: The best way to gain altitude is to find an updraft,
translation.ko: 고도를 높이려면 상승 기류를 타야 합니다

translation.en: known as a "thermal."
[Fiorenzo] When you hit the thermal, it's very similar
translation.ko: 온난 기류를 만나면 엘리베이터가 작동하는 것과 비슷한 느낌이에요

translation.en: to when you're in an elevator and it starts.
You feel a push upwards.
Yeah, there we go!
Just the power of nature to pull me up.
translation.ko: 자연의 힘이 절 밀어 올리는 겁니다

translation.en: When I'm flying and I see a bird circling up,
it means there must be a thermal there.
So we're always constantly looking at them.
You can really feel the balance between the gravity pulling you down
translation.ko: 절 끌어 내리는 중력과 밀어 올리는 공기의 힘이

translation.en: and the air lifting you up.
You can then use your bodyweight to gain speed,
translation.ko: 체중을 이용해서 속도를 내고 그 속도로 에너지를 만들어

translation.en: and use that speed to generate more energy
translation.ko: 속도를 내고 그 속도로 에너지를 만들어

translation.en: and feel that you're moving through the air.
translation.ko: 공기를 가르는 느낌을 즐길 수 있죠

translation.en: Gravity may be weaker on Earth than on Atlas...
but the thinner atmosphere means there's less buoyancy.
translation.ko: 대기 밀도가 낮기에 떠 있기도 더 힘듭니다

translation.en: So, eventually, everything falls.
On Atlas, the sky grazers never need to land.
translation.ko: 아틀라스의 스카이 그레이저는 착륙할 필요가 없습니다

translation.en: Their front and back wings are for direction and thrust.
translation.ko: 앞날개와 뒷날개는 방향을 잡거나 가속할 때 쓰고

translation.en: Their long middle wings are for catching thermals.
translation.ko: 가운데 있는 긴 날개는 온난 기류를 탑니다

translation.en: Despite their weight,
the air is thick enough for them to live a life
translation.ko: 빡빡한 대기 밀도 덕에 평생을 날며

translation.en: in the sky.
But it's not always a peaceful life.
As on Earth, grazers attract predators.
Using hydrogen-producing bacteria to inflate their air sacs,
translation.ko: 수소를 만드는 박테리아를 써서 공기 주머니를 부풀린 뒤

translation.en: they take to the skies.
Alone, they're no match for their prey...
so they hunt in a pack...
waiting for a sky grazer to stray from the group.
translation.ko: 스카이 그레이저 한 마리가 무리에서 나오길 기다립니다

translation.en: Target sighted, they expel their gas...
and attack from above.
The fastest predator on Earth
uses the same tactic.
[man] My interest in flying falcons is...
their predatory instinct coupled with the speed factor...
translation.ko: 포식자의 본능과 놀라운 속도가 합쳐졌기 때문이거든요

translation.en: and how they use that speed to their advantage.
But just watching a top predator do its thing...
is perfection.
I probably have 30-some birds at this moment.
translation.ko: 지금 데리고 있는 새가 30마리쯤 될 겁니다

translation.en: Each bird is a different personality.
What I love about falcons
is how evolution has made the most perfect specimen.
I do have a relationship with these guys.
Certainly from my end, I do. [laughs]
I don't think the falcons see it that way,
but they certainly see me as part of the team.
Vahe Alaverdian trains captive-bred falcons how to hunt.
translation.ko: 바헤 앨러버디언 씨는 인공 번식한 매에게 사냥을 가르칩니다

translation.en: [Vahe] These birds are genetically programmed
translation.ko: 이미 유전자 속에 최상위 조류 포식자의

translation.en: to be the top-notch avian predators that they are.
What we do as falconers
is try to awaken that predatorial nature in the bird.
Lure training is the very first step.
Come on, buddy! Hup, hup, hup, hup, hup!
I want to put that lure in front of the bird,
and get the falcon to coordinate eye to foot...
...and throw its feet out as if it's gonna grab it.
As that happens, I try to pull that away from the falcon
translation.ko: 그러면 저는 미끼가 잡히지 않게 돌리고

translation.en: to get it to shoot up in the air and repeat this process again.
translation.ko: 매는 하늘로 솟구쳐 날아간 뒤 같은 과정을 반복합니다

translation.en: I wanna see that bird drop down as vertical as it can.
translation.ko: 새가 최대한 수직으로 내려오는 걸 보고 싶어요

translation.en: That's something that they later on will apply to hunting game.
translation.ko: 나중에 사냥할 때 그 동작을 유용하게 쓸 겁니다

translation.en: When the falcons are ready, Vahe introduces a prey target...
translation.ko: 매가 사냥할 준비를 마치면 바헤는 목표물을 풉니다

translation.en: a racing pigeon.
The falcon can't keep up with the pigeon in a chase,
translation.ko: 매는 비둘기를 쫓아갈 정도로 빠르지 않기에

translation.en: so its best bet is to drop on it...
using gravity.
[Vahe] When the bird thinks that he's got the advantage,
that's when the wings will get tucked in.
They stoop into a little teardrop shape...
coming down from the heavens.
The kinetic energy of a falcon hitting a pigeon
would be as if you were hit by a cannonball.
In training, the pigeon invariably gets away,
translation.ko: 이런 훈련에서 비둘기는 반드시 도망에 성공합니다

translation.en: because the falcon is made to stoop from less than a thousand feet.
translation.ko: 매가 300m보다 더 낮은 곳에서 낙하를 시작하기 때문입니다

translation.en: When hunting for real,
it'll drop from a greater height...
to lethal effect.
The predators make their move.
They deploy their wings
to create drag...
destabilizing the sky grazer
to devour it on the ground.
But this pack is too small to take down such a large beast.
translation.ko: 그러나 이 정도 숫자로는 사냥이 힘든 크기입니다

translation.en: Today, they'll go hungry.
The sky grazer climbs to a safe height...
to recuperate.
But as a fertile female,
she has company.
Male grazers, competing to be chosen as a mate.
Their oversized tails are a handicap,
making it harder to fly.
But to the female, they're a sign of vitality.
translation.ko: 그러나 암컷이 보기엔 꼬리가 클수록 힘이 넘친단 뜻이죠

translation.en: The first to reach her gets to mate
and pass on his genes.
The same principle applies on Earth,
whether up in the sky
or down in the dirt.
Males compete for the right to mate.
[man 2] I think when people sit at home watching insects on television,
translation.ko: 사람들은 집에 앉아 TV로 곤충을 볼 때

translation.en: they imagine the cameraman sitting in the jungle,
in a river or in a hedge,
waiting for this beetle to come across
and reproduce or have a fight in front of the camera.
It doesn't work that way.
This is a ramshackle old shed which is attached to my parents' place,
translation.ko: 우리 부모님 집에 붙어 있는 낡은 오두막인데요

translation.en: which is just there.
Huge advantages to having a place attached to your mum and dad's.
translation.ko: 부모님 집 앞에서 촬영하면 좋은 점이

translation.en: You get good dinners in the evening and, uh, teas arriving during the day.
translation.ko: 저녁을 든든하게 먹을 수 있고 낮에 차도 나온다는 거예요

translation.en: -Have a look and see what we're doing. -Oh!
Oh, gosh.
Oh! What on Earth are they?
[Robert] They are rhinoceros beetles.
The male's got these big horns.
The female doesn't. It's a form of sexual selection,
because the females like males with big horns.
So every time they mate,
they'll mate with a beetle that has a slightly bigger horn
translation.ko: 마지막으로 본 녀석보다 뿔이 더 큰 수컷과

translation.en: -than the one they've last seen before. -Oh!
And, therefore, that male passes its genes on.
translation.ko: 그렇게 수컷 유전자가 다음 세대에 남는 거죠

translation.en: So, over generations, the horns will get bigger.
translation.ko: 세대가 지날 때마다 뿔이 커질 테고요

translation.en: -[man 1] Anywhere particular? -[Robert] Um, just on the... on the log facing the other male.
translation.ko: - 원하는 위치는요? - 다른 수컷을 마주보는 나무 위요

translation.en: [man 1] Here they go. They're going straight away.
The horns of a male rhinoceros beetle
are like the tail of a male sky grazer.
They've evolved for sexual competition.
-Ha-ha! -That dominant one's done it again.
[Robert] That's a good shot. The shot we wanted.
translation.ko: 화면 아주 좋은데요 우리가 원하던 짝짓기 시작 장면이에요

translation.en: -[man 1] Yeah. -[Robert] Going into her, yeah.
One, two, three.
-That right? -[Robert] Yeah.
-[man 1] Yep. -[man 3] That's it.
-Can I... Yes. -You putting that in?
Male insects don't always fight to snare a mate.
translation.ko: 수컷 곤충이 짝짓기를 위해 늘 싸우는 것은 아닙니다

translation.en: Sometimes it's enough just to show off their physical prowess.
[man 1] Right, I'm gonna bring the male in front of you.
He's coming in from your right.
Now, uh-- He's flown off.
These are stalk-eyed flies.
[Robert] Stalk-eyed fly is an amazing little thing.
It looks a little bit like an ant with massive eyes on the ends of stalks.
translation.ko: 긴 대롱 끝에 큰 눈이 달린 개미처럼 생겼어요

translation.en: Both the male and the female have eyes on the end of stalks,
translation.ko: 수컷과 암컷 모두 눈이 툭 튀어나와 있죠

translation.en: but the male has much longer eye stalks than the female.
The males with the long stalks will come up to one another,
translation.ko: 긴 대롱을 가진 수컷끼리 서로 접근하여

translation.en: and they will, kind of, have a little dance.
And they will try and judge
which of the two of them has the bigger stalks.
There they are. That's the standoff!
The winner of that will remain where they are and the loser will then toddle off.
translation.ko: 승자는 가만히 있고 패자가 자리를 뜹니다

translation.en: That winner then will gain access to the female, and be able to reproduce with her,
translation.ko: 승자는 암컷에게 접근할 권리를 얻어 번식하게 되죠

translation.en: and that way can pass on the genetics that he has,
which will include that of a longer eye stalk.
translation.ko: 갈수록 눈 대롱이 긴 개체가 나오는 겁니다

translation.en: -[Robert] Yes! Got it. -[man 1] Are-- are you on it?
Oh, It's fantastic.
Normally, it's a second and they're gone. This is fantastic.
Why would the male stalk-eyed fly go to the effort
of having these enormous eye stalks?
Well, the idea is that you are conspicuously signaling to the female
translation.ko: 아무짝에 쓸모가 없는 기관에 투자할 정도로

translation.en: that you can have this incredible investment of energy into this resource
translation.ko: 에너지가 남아돈다는 신호를 암컷에게 보내기 위한 용도입니다

translation.en: that is completely needless.
And if you can still survive,
if you can carry on flying and living and not getting predated upon,
translation.ko: 이런 쓸데없이 거대한 기관을 머리에 달고도

translation.en: and still have this... wasteful extravagance coming out of your head,
translation.ko: 잘 먹고 살아남아 포식자에게 당하지 않았다면

translation.en: then you're gonna be a pretty good bet to reproduce with.
On Atlas,
the long tail of the male sky grazer shows he's an ideal choice...
translation.ko: 긴 꼬리를 가진 수컷이 후손을 남길 대상으로

translation.en: to father the next generation.
But the mother can't lay her eggs in the sky.
translation.ko: 그러나 알을 허공에 낳을 순 없죠

translation.en: So she's come down to land.
Because of the gravity, she's too heavy to launch herself back into the sky.
To create new life, she must surrender her own.
translation.ko: 번식을 위해 암컷은 목숨을 바쳐야 합니다

translation.en: The babies grow up close to where their mothers die.
translation.ko: 새끼는 어미가 죽은 곳 근처에서 자랍니다

translation.en: Now they need to get off the ground and into the air.
translation.ko: 이제 땅을 벗어나 하늘로 도약할 때입니다

translation.en: But scavengers lie in wait.
Boneless creatures
with no skeleton to give them form.
translation.ko: 골격이 없어 형체가 잡혀 있지 않습니다

translation.en: They kill by enveloping and dissolving their prey.
The sky grazers have only just hatched, but already they're in grave danger.
translation.ko: 새끼들은 막 태어났지만 벌써 큰 위험에 처했습니다

translation.en: And now, there's no going back.
Every day on Earth,
young animals have to overcome terrible odds,
if they're to survive.
Sixty percent of meerkats don't make it to their first birthday.
[woman] For a young meerkat, in their early life,
there's a lot of danger here.
They're vulnerable for many months after they're born...
translation.ko: 태어난 후 몇 개월 동안은 아주 취약한 상태죠

translation.en: but particularly in the first month or two after they emerge from the burrow.
translation.ko: 굴에서 나온 뒤 첫 한두 달이 가장 위험해요

translation.en: Predators are everywhere, and a constant danger.
There are snakes in this area
that will eat a young meerkat.
A young meerkat is safe within a group,
but if it lags behind, it's vulnerable.
Scorpions are a constant threat.
[Kirsty] The young are really completely incompetent,
and totally ignorant when it comes to dealing with scorpions, initially.
translation.ko: 전갈을 마주하면 어떻게 해야 할지도 모르죠

translation.en: But they can't avoid this danger forever.
They're going to eventually have to learn how to neutralize the threat.
translation.ko: 상대를 제압하는 법을 언젠가는 배워야 합니다

translation.en: The first time that a young meerkat faces a scorpion
and it has to deal with it itself
is probably a terrifying encounter.
This is a real moment of truth.
It's a real rite of passage, because once they've managed to do that themselves,
translation.ko: 통과 의례라 할 수 있죠 일단 방법만 깨우친다면

translation.en: then they really are at a stage where they can start to forage by themselves
translation.ko: 곧 스스로 먹이를 구하는 법도 터득하고

translation.en: and become independent and be a useful group member.
translation.ko: 자기 앞가림도 하는 훌륭한 무리 구성원이 됩니다

translation.en: So, they've really managed to escape the vulnerability of being a pup
and made that transition into being an adult.
It's one step on the road to adulthood,
translation.ko: 어른이 되는 길에 한 발짝 들어선 거죠

translation.en: but it's by no means plain sailing after that.
translation.ko: 그렇다고 해서 그 길이 순탄한 것은 아닙니다

translation.en: There are a lot of threats out there,
and it will have to continue to learn in order to reach adulthood.
translation.ko: 어른이 되기까지 배워야 할 게 많으니까요

translation.en: If the young sky grazers are to grow up,
they have no choice.
It's time to fly.
Even in the air, they're still not safe.
On Atlas, survival is a game of chance.
Life goes on from one generation to the next.
translation.ko: 삶은 한 세대에서 다음 세대로 이어집니다

translation.en: At least for now.
The strong gravity of Atlas pulls asteroids onto a collision course.
translation.ko: 아틀라스의 강한 중력에 끌려 여러 소행성이 충돌합니다

translation.en: Most burn up in the atmosphere.
But there's a constant threat something big will get through...
and reset the course of life on the planet.
Because gravity is weaker on Earth than Atlas,
asteroid strikes are less frequent.
But when they do occur, they can be catastrophic.
translation.ko: 그러나 일단 충돌하면 얼마든지 대재앙이 될 수 있죠

translation.en: [man] This is the Yucatán Peninsula.
27,000 square miles of tropical jungle.
But hidden within the jungle are numerous sinkholes called cenotes.
translation.ko: 정글 중간중간에 '세노테'라 불리는 싱크홀이 여럿 있어요

translation.en: These are entrances to vast underground cave systems.
translation.ko: 아래에 존재하는 거대한 동굴로 통하는 입구죠

translation.en: There's no surface rivers or streams in the peninsula,
so the only source of water is underground in caves.
translation.ko: 수원이라고는 이런 지하 동굴 속 물뿐입니다

translation.en: But the really interesting thing is the location of these cenotes.
translation.ko: 정말 흥미로운 것은 세노테의 분포 위치인데요

translation.en: Although there's probably 10,000 or more cenotes across the peninsula,
translation.ko: 이 반도를 통틀면 세노테가 1만 개는 넘겠지만

translation.en: in the northwest corner...
they occur in a very well-defined semicircle.
translation.ko: 아주 선명한 반원 모양으로 세노테가 줄지어 있어요

translation.en: If we follow that semicircle out into the Gulf of Mexico...
translation.ko: 그 반원을 따라 멕시코만까지 선을 이어보면

translation.en: we now have a complete circle that marks what one would expect
translation.ko: 온전한 원이 완성되죠 마치 소행성이 충돌해서

translation.en: from the edge of an asteroid impact crater.
[Thomas] 65 million years ago,
gravity pulled an asteroid into our solar system.
translation.ko: 중력에 이끌려 한 소행성이 태양계로 들어왔어요

translation.en: It smashed into our planet,
causing the extinction of 75 percent of life on Earth.
The asteroid strike generated enough debris
to block out sunlight for two years.
A world plunged into darkness.
Nothing could grow.
This would happen on Atlas
if a big enough asteroid hit the planet.
translation.ko: 커다란 소행성이 떨어지면 그렇게 될 겁니다

translation.en: [Thomas] Cenotes are difficult places to survive...
just like the Earth was 65 million years ago.
What are the characteristics that a species needs to survive an extinction?
translation.ko: 멸종을 견디고 살아남으려면 어떤 특성을 가져야 할까요?

translation.en: Somebody's in here.
So, crocodiles are very resilient animals.
They live both in the water and on land.
They're generalists. They don't require a specific diet.
translation.ko: 잡식성이라 한 가지 식단만 고집하지 않죠

translation.en: They'll eat almost anything.
Whatever is available is good enough,
they'll take it.
Here in this cenote,
one's fallen in, gotten trapped, no way out...
translation.ko: 한 마리가 갇힌 채 나가지 못했는데요

translation.en: Somehow, some way...
he's succeeded.
They're survivors.
In a changing world, it pays to be a generalist,
not a specialist.
If a big enough asteroid hits Atlas,
the sky grazers and predators would be doomed.
They're too specialized to cope with change.
translation.ko: 한 가지에 특화되어 변화에 적응이 힘드니까요

translation.en: The generalists are the boneless scavengers.
translation.ko: 반면 뼈 없는 청소부 포식자는 여러 능력을 지녔죠

translation.en: Like crocodiles, they eat anything...
and live anywhere.
On this imagined high-gravity world,
translation.ko: 중력이 강한 이 상상 속 세계에서

translation.en: they could be the great survivors.
How might life adapt
on a different world,
where creatures are trapped
between a searing desert
and a frozen shadowland?
A world of extremes.
